intro: Echites pubescens, commonly known as the hairy echites, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it produces showy yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
